  • Constructor Details

    • LoginView

      public LoginView(LoginController lc)
      Constructs a new LoginView object with a reference to a LoginController. This constructor initializes a new instance of the LoginView class and associates it with the provided LoginController object.
      Parameters:
      lc - The LoginController object to associate with the LoginView.

  • Method Details

    • renderApp

      public void renderApp(int selection)
      Displays various options and performs corresponding actions based on the user's input. The renderApp method renders different parts of the application based on the selection parameter.
      Parameters:
      selection - The selection parameter determines which part of the application to render. Valid values are:
      • 0: Displays login choices for Admin, Manager, and Staff.
      • 1: Prompts the user for credentials.
      • 2: Navigates back to the reset password page.
      • 4: Exits the system.

    • credentialPrompt

      public void credentialPrompt()
      The function `credentialPrompt` prompts the user to enter a Staff ID.

    • loggedInPrompt

      public void loggedInPrompt(boolean auth)
      Checks if a user is authenticated and displays a message accordingly. The loggedInPrompt method checks the authentication status of the user and prints a message based on the value of the auth parameter.
      Parameters:
      auth - A boolean indicating whether the user is authenticated. - If true, the user is logged in successfully. - If false, the user authentication failed, and they need to retry.

    • updated

      public void updated(boolean upToDate)
      Checks if a password update was successful and navigates accordingly. The updated method checks whether the password update was successful based on the value of the upToDate parameter.
      Parameters:
      upToDate - A boolean indicating whether the password update was successful. - If true, the password was updated successfully. - If false, the password does not match or the update was unsuccessful.

    • displayInvalidAcc

      public void displayInvalidAcc()
      Displays a message indicating an invalid StaffID or Password and pauses execution briefly.

    • renderChoice

      public void renderChoice()
      The `renderChoice` method in Java overrides the superclass method to print borders for the "Login View".
